Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would go back”
Reviews.Author: kate_loves_A_holiday
Reviews.Content: We had a suite and it was lovely. The balcony was huge and had a good view: the location was brilliant. There was a path way that led right into the city. Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Button”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. Rang 4 days before hand and spoke to reception asking for bottle of bubbly to be brought up in ice bucket at 2.00pm ver friendly girl said there was a bottle in fridge but would organise for wine to be brought up. When we arrived I spoke to reception and asked if there was a request for the wine and she said yes. Unfortunately waited till 3.30pm and and it did not arrive. The tray in the oven had been turned over so it looked clean I had to scrub it as it was terrible and I had to wash some of the glasses as well. I would hope that when people book in for special occasions that their requests would be met.

Reviews.Title: “Donâ€™t think I will ever go back again !”
Reviews.Author: Candice213
Reviews.Content: Booked directly from the hotel website as I think King street wharf is a nice area to stay. Checked in without any problem but they didnâ€™t tell you the checkout time is 10AM and this made me quite upset the next morning. The hotel location is still quite close the train station as itâ€™s in between town hall and Wynyard stations. Itâ€™s also a relaxing walk towards cockle bay and darling harbor. My husband and I booked for one night as weâ€™re meeting up with few friends in the city and we decided not to drive back to my parentâ€™s home. My plan is to check out around 11ish and then have a relax brunch somewhere nearby . At around 9:55am the next morning , the cleaning lady was banning on the door as itâ€™s looks like weâ€™re late for check out. Weâ€™re still in bed and didnâ€™t realize the checkout time was so early. We end up need to rush out and is not the best mood to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Darling Harbour location!”
Reviews.Author: BlayneyDave
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Medina Grand Harbourside apartments in a Studio. These units offer a small kitchen area with cooking facilities, fridge & microwave and are great for those wanting to save a few dollars by making their own meals. The location is virtually on the wharf walkway and next door to the aquarium and all the restaurants and bars. Parking is limited and is first in first served but good security once you are in. The configuration of the Studio offers a japanese style screen to separate the bedroom and each unit has a small balcony to sit out on (ideal for smokers). We would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: The location at Darling Harbour is great but that is what you are primarily paying for as the rooms are average as is the service. We stayed 5 nights in a premier grand studio. The first morning we had housekeeping staff moving trolleys and talking loudly outside our room at 7.00am. At 9.00am we had housekeeping trying to get in to service the room! The balcony area was covered in dirt and grime. The heavy glass sliding doors to close off the bedroom from the living area were almost unmovable and after 3 reports to reception a maintenance man came on the third day. He said that one of the doors was "dangerous" and could fall if moved because of missing parts in the ceiling runner. The uneven floor level betweeen the passage and bathroom meant a "step up"to avoid tripping and falling. Plenty of dirt and dust clearly visible on either side of the washing machine and the glass topped tables all had permanent looking cup and glass bottom stains on them. We realized after leaving that we had been hit with a credit card surchage. No warning and no mention by the receptionist. To top it off we asked reception if they had contact with an airport shuttle bus company. Yes, they do the bookings. He was at least 15 minutes earlier than the agreed time and not happy we were not standing out the front. The small 8 seater was at least 20 years old, had no seat belts, and looked a bomb. The driver drove like an absolute maniac out to the airport frightening everyone onboard including a couple with a baby. Medina need to use another shuttle service urgently. Medina charge a premium tariff and claim to be of a high hotel standard. They need to lift their act dramatically, at least at these premises. Cannot recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay until last day”
Reviews.Author: moonpup
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment, a one bedroom with a studio room adjoining. We had booked a rollaway bed for my son to sleep on as his last night as a single man, however he did not use it so it remained in our lounge room the next morning. We luckily had our bedroom door closed as we heard a noise and when got up to see what was going on the rollaway had been removed. So much for privacy. Also during the morning whilst we were walking around our room one of the housekeeping staff came in calling out "mini Bar", I told him we had not used anything and he was going to knock on the door of the adjoining room where my other son was sleeping, I told him not to knock but he just called out "mini bar" until I told him to go away. Obviously did not speak very good English. All in all we were happy with our room, the bed was comfortable, good blockout curtains. The Lime cafe adjoining was good for breakfast and the location close to Darling Harbour is great. On the day we checked out however we took our luggage to reception and waited for someone to attach labels and put it in the lockup room where it stayed until we left for the airport in the afternoon. Just before we left we realised that my son's suit bag was missing and asked the receptionist if it was behind the reception or still in the lockup room, but no one seemed to know where it was. We had to leave for the airport but as my other son was still at the hotel for another night I asked him to follow it up. He again asked the reception if they knew where the suit was and they did not know, but the next time he asked it miraculously turned up behind the reception desk. Whilst we were happy to have the suit returned, it will now means that it will have to be posted back to us from Sydney at a cost we did not need to incur.

Reviews.Title: “Pennypinching best describes the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bowsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on two occasions,firstly for 4 nights in suite and very pleasant indeed.On second occasion we were booked for two nights and got caught by bad weather in Queensland.I phoned the hotel to advise that we might not arrive that night and subsequently rang again confirming that we were stranded and that room could be let go for that night.The first response on both occasions from the hotel was that we would have to pay for room,I had no problem with that and said so each time.Subsequenly I got a call from Booking.com asking why I hadn't taken up the reservation as they had the manager on the phone asking them.I also had to tell Booking .com that I would pay for the room.When we got to Sydney next afternoon and checked in we were given the noisiest and most decrepit studio room (as per original booking ) despite having paid two nights for it.The receptionist and duty manager confirmed that they had rang querying our "noshow" and that it was actually Booking.com that was charging for the room despite the very strong probability that the room had been relet for our missing night as they told me that they had full occupancy all week.It would have taken very little action on the hotel's part to have acknowledged our efforts to keep them informed of our whereabouts.I repeat that I had no difficulty in paying for the unused night as Jetstar had very kindly ( and full credit to them as the near cyclonic weather conditions certainly gave them a ready made opt out had they wished to use it ) put us up on Daydream Island overnight when we were weatherbound on Hamilton Island so we were not out of pocket financially at any rate. It's ironic that the posted reviews on both companies ended up being reversed.I had high expectations of the Medina and low to medium of Jetstar but they ended up being totally professional and the Medina as a tightfisted and customer cold operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: copperbuterfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. We arrived early & were greeted warmly by the staff who offered us baggage storage straight away. Our Studio king room was reasonably clean & comfortable although a bit cramped. We asked to be moved from our first room as the room faced Shelley st and was too noisy for us. The safe did not work & there was a leak in the bathroom vanity which the staff attended to promptly. The room we moved to the next day was quiet and we were able to sleep. The attention to detail of cleanliness could be improved for example the corners of the room needed cleaning as did the grout and soap scum around the shower. We were given a car park when we turned up with a car ( you cannot book a spot) and staff were very helpful in organising this for us. The cost was $32 a day. We were told that they only have 20 car parks allocated for this hotel otherwise, they could direct us to another car park 5 min away which was slightly dearer. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and a comfy bed, helpful staff in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, Staff less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: SJ S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend with my siblings for a nice weekend away, however we all left disappointed. Before checking in we called asking information about parking and were told the price and that it they only had 2 carparks left and we couldn't reserve one! This was not a good start seeing as we were still a couple hours away from sydney. Luckly we found else where to park the car. The second day of our stay we put the room as a do not disturb sign on the room as we were out for the day and and had items of high value in the room we didn't want people in and out of the room while we were away for that much time. When arriving back to the hotel we saw that the house keeping had come into the room even with the do not disturb sign on the door! Happy nothing was missing however very annoyed that privacy was not an option. During the stay we found staff less that interested to acknowledge our request (one out of 3 completed with out us chasing it up.) The hotel itself was lovely. Hotel staff need improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Modern unit in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Fergford
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a self-contained one bedroom unit for three nights while in Sydney at the end of our holidays. Harbour view, short walk to restaurants, trains, monorail and ferries. Opposite lots of good bars and near the Casino. Couldn't ask for a better location. Room was good size with a kitchen including a dishwasher and washing machine/dryer. Comfy bed. Good service. Will be staying there again next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Average price average hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammytina
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night while attending a trade show, the location is handy if a little grotty in the surrounding streets. The room was very clean, and handy to have a fridge and kettle in the kitchetette. If you can get bthis place on a "special" rate it is adequate as trade show accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SquintyMaginty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Media Grand Harbourside over the weekend in one of their studio rooms and I loved everything about these apartments. The location was excellent, I received great service, it was a clean beautiful room, tastefully decorated, with a modern flat screen TV, a safe, a beautiful large king size bed with wonderful pillows, and ironing facilities. It was a hot weekend and the air conditioner worked well. The room had an attached kitchenette with complimentary tea and coffee, and a well stocked minibar. I did not have a view it looked out over the Sydney Aquarium roof tops, but that did not matter to me. They also allowed late check out for a reasonable fee. I was very comfortable there and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dump #2”
Reviews.Author: Ishkaa
Reviews.Content: Absolutely appalling. Booked a "Premium Studio" and received a room overlooking the Aquariums rubbish bins. Fabulous view...NOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The room was filthy, no surface had been cleaned, fingermarks over every cupboard and dirty linen. I was also put next to the one lift that worked. Room was extremely noisy so 2 hours sleep max. Bed was the worst I had slept in over my entire holiday.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in a city”
Reviews.Author: the_mcguigans
Reviews.Content: We are not city people, but having gone to Australia for the 3rd time we thought we ought to see Sydney. The Medina was a very good choice, well located for transport access - we used the ferries and the monorail to name but 2. Our suite had good facilities - including washing machine and a useful kitchenette. Shopping for groceries was a little limited but the local "convenience store" was OK. If you want quality accommodation with slightly more ability to â€œdo it yourselfâ€� than a standard hotel this is a very good option. Sydney Aquarium next door too!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable & awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: aussie_shark_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room was small and a bit pokey. It had a comfortable KS bed, with crisp linen. A small desk had a flat screen TV & power points to charge appliances. A large mirrored wardrobe overlooked the bed. A glass sliding door opened onto a private balcony. The room had air conditioning. The small kitchen alcove near the front door had a food & drinks mini bar, bar fridge and a small selection of cutlery & crockery. The large spacious bathroom had the toilet, basin with long counter and large shower recess. Plenty of white fluffy towels and range of toiletries are on supply. The water temperature and pressure were great. I had full Next G mobile phone and internet reception. I am not sure of the cost of wifi cost or laundry service. Room service is offered & delicious â€“ from the lobby restaurant. The best thing about the place is the location: walking distance to Darling Harbourâ€™s bars cafes & restaurants, the Sydney Aquarium, museums, cinemas and so many other tourist attractions. And if you are driving, there is secure undercover parking at a fee.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: travellerBallarat
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights at medinda February 2012. Arrived early and was able to leave luggage withh receception, all paperwork for checkin done then also. Stayed in one bedroom apartment cityview, balcony was not very well maintained ,cobwebs all over the outside walls, dirty table and chairs. Inside complementary milk was four days out of date, kitchen bench on louge side was filthy with old liquid runs . Hair dryer did not work, but to their credit as soon as told about hairdryer a new one was installed when we got back . On up side great location , and noise level low as double glazing. Overall very disappointed when consider cost

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite”
Reviews.Author: faimacc
Reviews.Content: We visit and stay in Sydney often ,this was our first time at the Medina Grand.We stayed 2 nights in January and can't wait to come back. We love Darling Harbour and had the best time,there is so much to see and do within walking distance of the hotel. We were up graded, without asking, to a room with fantastic views. The lovely young lady at check-in could not have given us a warmer welcome and been more helpful. Not the flashiest hotel in town but excellent value and service. See you again soon:-)

Reviews.Title: “Medina Grand”
Reviews.Author: Greg Y
Reviews.Content: Friendly, comfortable and convenient apartment hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kay187054
Reviews.Content: Good value, great location (a few steps away from Darling Habour) and friendly staff. Affordable hotel - not the best looking, nor particularly fancy, but everything needed was provided by helpful staff. Good-sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Looking tired.”
Reviews.Author: Lynellen
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs desperately to invest in new bath towels. Currently they are worn, stained & unattractive. Blanket provided was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel that could be better”
Reviews.Author: Andrew046
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights over an extended weekend in Sydney. The hotel itself is modern and new and kept quite clean. In terms of location, it is about a 5-10 minute walk from Wynyard Station, and conveniently close to the more recently developed Kings Street Wharf where there are many restaurants. The room overlooked the Aquarium, and it was a short walk to the Darling Harbour district. I asked for a room on a higher level and we were put on the top floor. It overlooked the top of the Aquarium and the motorway. We were put in room 101 which was oddly shaped, and felt very cramped and small, which was quite a disappointment after hearing about the spacious rooms. The service at the desk was a bit stilted but polite. The television remote was missing from the room, and a friendly man came with another remote and checked to make sure it worked with the television. The double bed had a divide in the middle which was a bit annoying, and the bed was harder than my personal preference. There was a little kitchenette with a kettle for coffee and tea and a fridge. The bathroom was more spacious and the facilities clean. Unless you can find a greatly discounted room, I think there are better hotels to stay at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Year stay at the Medina Grand”
Reviews.Author: waywayway
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom apartment and arrived at 1pm, were told that the room was not ready but that we could leave the luggage with her and come back later, a nice touch. When we went back to collect our keys the luggage had already been taken to our room, The room itself was clean and very spacious with separate dining and lounge area with large patio doors, we had tv's in both the lounge and bedroom with plenty of channels to choose from, the kitchen was well equipped and had full range of appliances and utensils King Street Wharf was just over the road and had plenty of bars and restraurants, and a short walk takes you to cockle bay wharf, This is a great place and we encountered no problems during our stay, Next time we are in Sydney, we will be back

Reviews.Title: “A One Nighter”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Gold Coast and stayed here as an interim arrangement before joining a friend in his house. Hotel is ideally located right next to Darling Harbour and the amazing variety of Restaurants there. The rooms are typical service appartment type and suffice for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here after picking up a great internet offer of $124/night for a city view king studio. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, the pillows werenâ€™t too thick, and lighting was excellent. The air-conditioning was quiet and responsive to temperature changes. There was no penetration of external noise despite the close proximity to free ways. There was ample storage space for our small overnight bags, a desk (with a range of quality magazines) and chair, and a small table with two chairs, which left little space to move around, but for the price, we certainly werenâ€™t complaining. The compact bathroom was attractive and modern, with a spacious shower and an excellent shower head with strong water pressure. The bath towels were quite small, and not very thick, but this was a minor issue. The kitchenette was functional, with a microwave, toaster, crockery and cutlery. Reception staff were friendly and accommodating, offering post checkout luggage storage without being asked. A complementary newspaper was available on request. We normally drive to Sydney, but with the Harbour Bridge closed to traffic for resurfacing, we caught the train. The hotel is an easy seven minute walk from Wynyard Station (York Street exit). The location is terrific for easy access to ferries at Darling Harbourâ€™s King Street Wharf, and for walking everywhere in the CBD. We didnâ€™t eat at the attached restaurant, Lime. If you are looking for great breakfast fare and good coffee at very reasonable prices nearby, try the Central Baking Depot at 37-39 Erskine Street (between Sussex and Kent Streets). Dinner (or lunch) just around the corner from the Medina at the Malaya is always delicious. All in all, a great place if you can pick up a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Dry Sauna”
Reviews.Author: Whateverr
Reviews.Content: In December, I stayed st the Medina Grand Harbourside. The service was very good and the room was clean. The dry sauna was disappointing as it was my first experience with a sauna. I did not break a sweat, which I was expected to. The swimming pool was too cold to swim in the morning. Otherwise it is very much a wonderful hotel and I would recommend everyone to stay there. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good functional room in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MadHattor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which has a separate bedroom, kitchen, living area and bathroom with washer and dryer. The kitchen was not well equipped but this was easily and quickly rectified with a call to housekeeping. The apartment is smallish but Sydney is an expensive place and I would consider this the norm. Great air conditioning system and the best shower pressure I have ever had in Australia. Basically the room has everything to make your stay comfortable and is clean and tidy. There is certainly no great wow factor but nor is it priced (for Sydney) as such. Daily housekeeping service did a great job as did the friendly and helpful front desk staff. The double walled system kept the noise from the busy motorway to an acceptable level. There is a small but pleasant pool on the ground floor. Only 200 metres away is the Darling Harbour ferry stop and a very short walk gets you to the Aquarium and Darling Harbour. If you are travelling with kids, Tumbalong Park behind the Imax theatre is a must with a fantastic water play area and sand playground. Overall, this represents good functional amenities in a very handy location and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with easy access to City & Darling Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: Tazzieg
Reviews.Content: Family stayed here for conference at Darling Harbour. Great location, can walk everywhere. Lounge room doesn't have proper curtains, only sheer ones which meant we all had to cram into bedroom which was tiny & hardly fitted porta cot to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay......”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I recently stayed at The Medina for the first time. My husband booked the apartment some time ago, when we bought tickets for the Harry Potter Exhibition. On the day of checkout, we noticed on our final itemised account, that the rates for the two nights we stayed there varied....we queried this when we went to pay our bill and were told that their room rate changed daily. Well we could understand that if one of the nights happened to fall on a public holiday or a weekend, but this was a Monday and Tuesday night! The Tuesday night was about $30 more. We were told that the rate changes due to room availability, which we found very strange when we pre-booked it months in advance. Anyway in the end the receptionist spoke to the Manager at our request, but nothing changed and in the end we ended up paying the full amount, which lead us to leave on a sour note after such a nice stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location ! rooms are large and OK-ish quality”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Medina Grand H S a few times over periods of 1 to 2 weeks...a mix of business and pleasure. Make sure you request a room NOT facing the express way as it is VERY noisy. The size of the rooms are great, all fully AC'ed of course and the front desk staff are pleasant. BUT the housekeeping staff are the worst i have come across in the many many hotel/serviced aprt i have stayed in across the world. They were very inconsistent in their quality, replacing some mini bar items one night and not the other, same same for making the bed !!!...and on 1 occasion i found my room door wide open with cleaning bags on the floor.....i waited 30mins for the cleaner to return but they had clearly forgotten and walk off leaving my door open....i mentioned this to the front desk staff who seemed suitable horrified but offered nothing other than a sorry....i will stay again, but hope my door is closed next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location amongst other things”
Reviews.Author: MarkusandLeanne
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a stay here. Great location for us, attending exhibition at circular quay. Great access to the city,,'smother attractions. Great rooms and other facilities, including breakfast cafe on ground floor. Very helpful staff. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location amidst all of the action!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany4567
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December for one night, as a stopover before an overseas flight from the airport. I had researched accommodation for quite a while before deciding on this hotel and found a good rate for the night, considering the location. We arrived at the hotel a little early, around 1.30pm, though we were still able to check in at this time, which was appreciated. Check in was quick, although the girl who checked us in was a little stand-offish and did not look very happy to be at work. Our room was on the 8th floor which we very happy with considering the cheap rate we booked the room with through Wotif. We had a view of the city and the Aquarium, and a balcony, though we didnâ€™t spend any time out here during our stay due to the poor weather. Our studio room was small but this suited us fine, as we were only staying for one night anyway. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice and spacious. One thing that put me off a little was that the toiletries provided by the hotel (shampoo, body gel etc) were half empty, meaning they had probably not been replaced from earlier guests by the housekeeping staff. We slept well despite being located right next to the busy main road; the double glazing works well to ensure guests a good nightâ€™s sleep. The location of the hotel is excellent; just a few minutes to Darling Harbour, and about 15-20 minutes into the CBD/Circular Quay. The City is very well set out and we found it quite easy to navigate with a very basic map. We did not eat at the Hotelâ€™s restaurant nor did we use the pool, so I cannot comment on those facilities. One more thing worth mentioning is the lifts â€“ they were very quick and arrived almost immediately everytime we used them. This was impressive during holiday time (mid December) when I thought they would have been slow due to an increased number of guests. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Sydney and would definitely stay at the Medina again purely for the location, which was unbeatable in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious room in handy location”
Reviews.Author: packaporte
Reviews.Content: We booked this 3 night stay direct through the Medina site and paid AUD $155/165 per night. Reception was friendly, we were automatically given two room key-cards (not standard practice in my experience in Australia). The room was a 'Premier Studio Room' and although it advertised a king bed I'm not sure if it was a king or queen. The room had a kitchen, the bed was located behind what are supposed to be sliding glass screens, but of the 3 screens, only 1 was working. This apartment has been designed with care, but fittings, such as the sliding screens to the bed area, have not lasted well. The glass topped tables had marks and stains on them, various metal fittings needed replacement etc. But that is being VERY picky as these things did not detract in any way from the general look of the room. Handy powerpoints for all our chargers and laptop, 2 tvs. Another thing that was looking a little worse for wear were the towels, they were clean and white but some were clearly quite old and need to be pensioned off. We ate in the Lime Cafe for breakfast one morning, staff were new so there were some teething problems, but the coffee was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wittsjo
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel december 2011. Rooms were comfortable, spacious and practical. Both kitchen and washing machine in the room is practical. The gym was good. Location is very good with both the city and darlington harbour close by. Nothing particular to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Dilys60
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel in December 2011 and we thoroughly recommend it to other travellers. The facilities in the room included a full kitchen, washing machine and dryer. The room was spacious, fresh, light and very clean.We had a one bedroom suite on the top floor overlooking Darling Harbour, noise was not an issue as there was double glazing installed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is very close to all activities at Darling Harbour and convenient for touring Sydney. Pricing is high but acceptable considering location and view. We will look forward to returning to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: joffw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for a couple of nights. The location is good with a 5 minute walk to get to central Darling Harbour. Whilst I arrived early (10am) before the 2pm check in, the room wasn't ready until about 2.40pm - however upon arrival the front desk staff helpfully stored my luggage securely and brought up my luggage once the room was ready. The room was a well-sized 1 bedroom apartment. The room was in excellent condition and was nice and clean. Overall the hotel would be great for business people or tourists who are wanting to be based in Darling Harbour. The rooms are clean and modern and you have all the conveniences of a kitchen and washer/dryer in room.

Reviews.Title: “Average apartment in great location.”
Reviews.Author: missannabelle2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip recently and found the apartments to be fairly average. The studio apartment I had was on the small side with a long narrow hallway that was difficult to move luggage through. Room service food was quite good & delivery was prompt. Great location- right near Darling Harbour & a 10 minute walk to Pitt St Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: SusanYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a very nice apartment in a nice part of central Sydney. We booked a one bedroom premier apartment. On the hotel website this type of apartment looks very bright and light, however, the apartment we stayed in resembled more the standard one bed apartment for the amount of light and brightness. It seems that the main difference between the standard and the premier apartments is that the premier apartments are on the top two floors facing Darling harbour. The apartment block is not on the actual harbour, it is surrounded by another apartment block and the aquarium. For me it was worth paying the extra money for the premier apartment as I wanted to be on a high floor. The apartment was very spacious. The bathroom was large and had a bath with a very powerful over-bath shower. The bathroom also housed the washing machine and tumble dryer in a cupboard. This was a fantastic addition to the apartment and was free to use (washing powder was available for a small charge). The sofa and chair had some stains, ie probably ready to be replaced or cleaned. But the bed was comfortable and the kitchen was more than adequate. Both the bedroom and lounge had patio doors onto the balcony. The outdoor pool was lovely and there is a beautiful garden area around the pool with a few sunbeds. Internet access was very expensive but there are free wifi hotspots on Darling Harbour. The staff are extremely helpful and are a great asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: brian T
Reviews.Content: We looked at the comments for the Medina and some of them were not good. I'm glad we ignored the bad ones! These apartments are perfectly located close to restraunts, transport and attractions and yet you can sleep like a baby because of the excellent soundproofing. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and our overall impression was one of good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Really noisy in their low-noise rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sandyosullivan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the staff are great, but this has got to be the noisiest place in Sydney. I requested a quiet room (and the lovely front desk staff complied), but there is clearly no such thing because the room I am staying in (yes, still here, sadly) is incredibly noisy. Both inside and outside of the place is just noise constantly. I booked in early (they were really accommodating with this) and even with earplugs in, I could hear constant noise. It was to distraction. I was wishing for a noisy air conditioner just to provide some white noise to drown it out. I've stayed in dozens of places in Sydney city that my noise-phobic self could cope with, but this is just too much. The actual room is great, with good facilities, and if you don't care about noise it's worth staying. In fact they just had a fireworks display and at least that drowned out the drone of noise that has been constant all day.

Reviews.Title: “In a great location for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ladyloch
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for our 25th wedding anniversary in a water view apartment. It was ideal for us, a good size, good seating and kitchen. It overlooks one row of buildings along the waterfront and is so close to Monorail, ferrys, boat tours and restaurants - all within a couple of minutes walk. Lime Street Cafe is great for breakfast and other meals. The staff were friendly and it was very convenient for breakfast. The hop on hop off sightseeing bus has two stops nearby, the nearest 2 minutes walk away. We were very happy with our stay here and really love Darling Harbour. The only negative was that our air conditioner wasnt working but they checked it and gave us two fans to keep us cool. There are no curtains/blinds in the lounge area and it gets very bright and hot in the afternoon. There was a noisy bar over the road but with double glazing we couldnt hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for 6 nights”
Reviews.Author: terry369
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 5/F apartment with Aquarium view (as per requested). The Preimer studio was nice. There was a Firework show in darling harbour last Sat (Oct 29). our 5/f aparment enjoyed a very good location to the firework!!! that was a bonus. the location is very good. next to the king street wharf. and walkable distance to Light rail and City rail. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. One thing they should note is the noise from the corridors. every morning when ppl left the room, we can easily hear what they said. Besides, i would suggest them to offer a 2-hr free wifi per day. I know it's not common to offer free wifi all day in Sydney(maybe in Aussie as well), but it's not convenient for the tourists. I wonder if there's any one-bedroom apartment which will have the FULL darling habour view, i guess the apartment in 6/f may do. Definitely will stay here if we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with opportunity to improve.”
Reviews.Author: Bobbali99
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on many occasions previously and the location is great. Easy access to city and Darling Harbour. Room this time clean and well presented. The corridors outt ooof the lift well were very much unclean on my level (6th floor) with a mop and bucket sitting next to lift for some time. Needed a good vacume. Had problem with key card to access lift and room buuuut this seems to be a common problem with Meedina hotels. Overal a compfortable stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family with small children”
Reviews.Author: DaianaMag
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay in a one bedroom apartment with our nearly 5 yr old daughter. Apartment was very clean, couldn't fault it other than the inability to open the sliding doors out onto the balcony. We were on the second floor. Our room overlooked the Sydney Aquarium which was nice. The windows are double glazed so there was definitely no street noise. Walking distance to the King Street Wharf where there are heaps of restaurants to choose from. Would definitely stay there again as well as recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Took the shine off the trip”
Reviews.Author: Nick U
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay in a premiere grand studio room. Trip did not start well after having to circle the block 6 times before being able o get a park to check in only to be told there was no parking available at the hotel. Rang up to inquire 2 weeks prior and was told parking would not be a problem. Room was average. Had the room shown in the pictures but room has deteriorated since the photos were taken. Room was not clean!! Benches and floor dirty, stains on walls, doors, and cupboards. Judging from the amount of dust on the picture frames, japanese sliding walls and bed head the room hadn't had a thorough clean in months. All air vents were filthy. Carpet was ripped sliding walls were coming apart at top and the shower screen wasn't attached properly to the ceiling. Even the lifts were not clean. Check in and check out were the only times any staff acknowledged we were there. On the positive side the hotel is in a great position. Reception area looks great and the gym pool and sauna are all clean and good to use. No road noise could be heard in the rooms thanks to the double glazing. and very easy to get a taxi from the front of the hotel anytime. The holiday was for my wife's birthday and our anniversary and we were looking forward to the comforts of a 4.5 star hotel. Unfortunately the 3 star accommodation we endured was just enough to take the shine off the trip. regards Nick Upton

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a Sydney weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gerry C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Medina Grand harbourside for two nights mid October. We landed at the airport at 6.30 and were checked in and dining with friends at King Street Wharf by 7.30. The location is fantastic - especially if you don't have a car and intend to stroll around and see the sights. As we were treating ourselves, I'd booked a Premier one bedroom apartment. It gave us plenty of room and had everything we needed. The bedroom was lovely and quiet to sleep in and the bed was very comfortable. Our balcony looked straight down towards the Aquarium and Wildlife world so I had great fun watching the koalas climbing around. A slightly surreal touch in such a busy and happening spot! We were in town for a wedding - and the reception was held on a gorgeous big boat that cruised the harbour for five hours and then dropped us right at our doorstep at King Street Wharf. This is the best place to stay if you are doing any private functions cruising the harbour. The service was quite friendly but was the only part that slightly let the hotel down. On checking in we asked for directions to the place we were meeting friends on King Street Wharf for dinner and the woman at reception didn't seem to be familiar at all with what was available on King Street Wharf. The paper I had ordered for the Saturday morning wasn't delivered and I had to ask for it to be sent to the room, and when we picked up our luggage out of storage on the Sunday afternoon, the person from reception completely missed one of our bags and had to be requested to go back and get it when she was already out on the street hailing a cab. Overall these are minor quibbles but they were small annoyances that could have been avoided. I would love to stay here again, and I'm certainly going to recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: DiMazzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights mid October. Excellent location. Very quiet, very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My First Time At The Grand Harbourside”
Reviews.Author: leo v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Harbourside during a business/getaway trip in the second weekend of October 2011, I stayed 3 nights . The first thing that went wrong was that they have only 20 cark park spaces available for their guests, the rest are leased out to corporate clients. They told me that I could park about 15 minutes away in Sussex Street, this was rectified eventually by the receptionist. The second thing that went wrong was that they ran out of room keys, the receptionist could not find any more keys. This was eventually rectified. The third thing that went wrong was that I wasn't given the room that I booked, I booked a Premier Apartment and never got to use it. When I checked my confirmation of the booking letter it was definitely a Premier Room I reserved, the receptionist told me that she would notify the manager and that they would get back to me and see what they could do. This never happened. The Fridge in my room needed replacing, was hard to close and worn. The cleaning of the rooms was just ok, could be better. Everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lisaluvs2travel71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights to attend a conference at the Entertainment Centre. Location fantastic. Room great with a small kitchenette. Bathroom was the cleanest of any Hotel I have stayed in and water pressure in shower brilliant. Bed was very comfortable and the room was super quiet. Staff lovely. Could not fault the place. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: MichaelL01
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Medina Grand Harbourside while attending a medical conference in Sydney Convention Centre. Had a 1 bedroom apartment with partial harbour views over Darling Harbour, nice facilities inc 2 TV's, kitchenette, balcony, cabled internet (at cost). Supplied toiletries were very average and bars of soap were the smallest I have experienced. Mattress on King Bed was verrryy soft and seemed larger than the bed base on which it rested leaving unsupported corners. Newspaper arrived late, after I left each morning, Service was average (they left the cleaning rag in the bathroom and did not change the towels on the last day), and they overcharged us when we checked out (later refunded willingly when I pointed it out). Overall, great location in the middle of everything, 10mins walk to Convention Centre, 10 mins to major department stores but service and luxury is a compromise. Maybe 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ML320Australia
Reviews.Content: We had a business trip and ended our weekend in this clean, modern hotel. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment, which had all the modern amenities including a washing machine, kitchen with a dishwasher. There was a nice small lounge where we were able to watch TV and relax and a separate bedroom. Our room only gave us a limited view of the harbour, but I expect if you had booked a larger room, one would have gotten a better view. It was clean. practical, but not luxurious. The bed was a standard queen bed with standard linen and the towels were adequate. All in all, it was very practical. It would have been nice to have a few extra touches, such as larger fluffier towels, a softening of the bedrooms. It was just all so practical. One thing that was a minor, but quite important to me was the very inadequate hairdryer. It was functional, but barely did its job. Location could not be faulted. It was right on the harbour side so getting around sydney was very easy. Most places were within walking distance and the front desk was very helpful. I enjoyed the complimentary newspapers and magazines. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Shawn A
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel! Incredible location, super helpful staff (Rebecca), and great rooms. We'll def be back, and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessajeffriess
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October with my boyfriend and loved it. The rooms and location were excellent and the staff were very friendly. I have nothing but good things to say, we thoroughly enjoyed our time here and would love to come back next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy this hotel, but staff pick up your game”
Reviews.Author: saffy55151
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy this hotel and other Medinas, because of position, size, facilities, but managers please get your staff to log wake up calls. The lady at reception wrote down my request- but it never happened. I had an early flight and I always think what if my cell phone crashes !!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl44_9
Reviews.Content: Having read a few negative reviews I was in two minds about whether or not to stay here, but gave it a go due to the location - which is brilliant - and was very pleasantly surprised wth my overall experience. Reception staff were friendly and checked me in promptly, I also experienced very good service on check out, and there was no problem storing my luggage for a few hours. I never had to wait more than 1 minute to flag down a taxi from the front of the hotel as they're continuously driving past, but you can also get to the train within a couple of minutes walk. I'd read there was a convenience store and bottle shop nearby so asked for directions to these - they're literally next door to one exit from the hotel which is very handy. There are heaps of bars & restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel, but as it was pouring with rain & cold during my stay, I decided to make use of the kitchen in my studio room. The studio room was great and had heaps of space, plus flat sceen TV in the lounge room & bedroom, oven, hotplates, full size fridge & microwave in the kitchen, balcony overlooking Wildlife World, and a good size bathroom with a shower over the bath & washing machine & dryer tucked away in a cupboard. It was also very clean and in good condition. The bedroom's separated by Japanese style sliding screens which use the space quite cleverly, and although it wasn't the comfiest bed in the world, it wasn't too bad and I had no noise issues. Overall I thought the hotel was very good value for money and I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: HolsandG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were really excited about this stay but were sadly let down. First the positives, location - amazing, worth the price you pay. I wouldn't however splash out on a 'room with a view' because you wot really get one. We had a grand premier suite which was lovely, spacious and confortable. The night Reception were pleasant and helpful. But the negatives... Day time reception staff were rude and a little snotty, seemed like a chore to have to greet us. But the big negative was the room service. These rooms are serviced apartments. We left our little card in the door and the card on the pillow plus the towels in the bath, as you are requested to do for the room to be serviced. We returned at 10pm to two folded towels in the bathroom and the bed unmade, messier than we left it. Our pillows were on the floor and the sheets not even tucked in and cornered. This hotel is supposed to be reputable. It put a horrible dampner on our overall experience, having spent $200+ on our room and then having to make the bed and straighten up the living room.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel stay! Convenient and cosy place.”
Reviews.Author: AiKen0901
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights in the Premier Grand Studio room. The living room is spacious and the interior is nicely designed which adds in the cosy feel. As both my husband and I are small built, we are comfortable with the bedroom, which others might find it a little squeezy. Our room faced the back of Sydney Wildlife Park with the highway at the side, but we did not hear the noise from the cars on the highway. The location is easily accessible from Wynyard station, approx 15mins walk. It's less than 5 mins walk from the Darling Harbour ferry terminal, and 10mins walk from Cockle Bay Wharf. A very convenient place. The service is excellent - friendly and helpful staff, with good housekeeping. It was a memorable stay for both of us, and we would definitely go back to the hotel again in future, and even trying out the other Medina hotels in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: katess85
Reviews.Content: After reading some not so great reviews about this hotel I was a little worried about staying here & even considered cancelling our booking. However I was more than impressed with this hotel. We stayed for only 1 night but could have easily stayed in this hotel for a week. Check in was quick & easy, although they do put a holding amount of $100 on your credit card like many other hotels. The room was much bigger than an ordinary hotel room. There was a full kitchen, a very nice bathroom & a seperate bedroom with a large bed. There is a large balcony from which we could see the harbour, and there is double sliding glass doors to keep out the noise from the streets below â€“ makes for a very peaceful sleep. The best thing about this hotel is itâ€™s location. A 30 second walk to the amazing restaurants on the King Street Wharf side of Darling Harbour & a pleasant stroll to the other side where there are even more restaurants & bars. So many places to choose from & something to suit every budget. Also very close to the monorail, Imax, Sydney Convention Centre & is also within walking distance of Sydney CBD. We went to a show at the Royal Theatre & this was also only a 10 minute walk. We did not use any public transfer for the entire weekend. Parking is available on site for $32 per day. All up we were very impressed with this hotel & will definatley be staying here again on our next visit to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: crusaders55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 day break wanting to be able to explore Sydney harbour etc easily.. Great Location. Easy walking distance of everything including good dining spots and city shopping Previous reviews struck bad attitude at reception but we found staff most helpful. On arrival because we had to stay an extra night and booked thru expedia deal we originally would have had to change to another room for one night but they were able to juggle things and for an extra $20 we were a able to stay in our deluxe room. Good size lounge and Kitchen, comfy bed. Clean. No traffic noise due to double door glazing as we were on the Motorway side. Disappointing view on to the back of the Aquarium but as we got a good deal you cant expect everything!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ryanandsophie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, fantastic rooms, helpful friendly staff. Couldnt ask for better from a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not to shabby at all .”
Reviews.Author: MikekNZ
Reviews.Content: I like TripAdvisor, thats why I write reviews, always good to contribute back, so therefor its always a bit of a worry when someone (my company) group booking us into a place which I have never heard of and havent had a chance to check out on TA to make sure its not bed bug ridden or something. In this case however the Medina was actually not a bad choice. We were attending a conference at the nearby conference center. Its about a 10min walk away, there are closer hotels than this, but its a pretty easy walk . The hotel itself is pretty nice, my room, was very quiet despite being close to a busy road, but there was no noise to speak of, the room itself was reasonable size, had a little kitchen type thing , and a desk area and table and chairs. It was more than enough for 1, The bathroom was nice and the shower was Great! - it had one of those roof mounted nozzles and the pressure was exceptional and hot . Very much enjoyed that. A couple of small improvements that could have been made 1) the safe was totally dead, first time I had encountered that 2) The tv, is a little small for the size of the room, and distance from the bed, a bit bigger would have been a lot easier to watch . The internet is ok, but its a ripoff price, $12 an hour, $25 a day or 60 for 3 - I cant really see the justification for that apart from profiteering, it also makes it clear you cant have more than 1 device per payment - which sucks - its 2011 !! People have multiple devices - I had a IPHONE an IPAD and LAPTOP, if im going to have to pay what is top dollar, restricting me to 1 device is very annoying. The magnetic swipe cards are a pain to , mostly in the lifts, they make you swipe to get to your floor - but very annoying, if you get it with someone on say level 5, and your on level 4 - he swipes first and if the elevator moves, it wont let you swipe your card, it just flashes, so you get a ride with him, then you have to stop , swipe again before someone else calls the lift otherwise you get another ride - happened to a couple of us a few times. I didnt have a lot of chance to interact with the staff - however one morning I left the do not disturb sign on the door, and went for the day, it was actually a mistake, but my mistake. What was nice, was the fact that they didn't go in, but did leave a bag of towels at the door, a nice and helpful touch, something I cant remember happening before - So thats pretty good. The other thing was the Fire Alarm sounded at 6am, which is a bit of a pain, thankfully using the speaker system they didnt make you go out onto the road, like other places I have stayed where they make you jump out of bed, go down the stairs in the cold and stand in the road. , they actually just asked you to stay in their rooms and then let everyone know about 5 mins later it was a false alarm. Which was great. So overall, not a bad place - few annoying bits - most notably the internet - but wouldn't have a problem going back .

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CanberraMum86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio room with a king bed (which was actually 2 beds pushed together, not an actual king bed) with my 2 young kids. Overall the stay was quite disappointing : ( The hotel itself really heeds an upgrade, the decor appears old and dated. The room was even worse, the appearance was old and uninviting. The shower was tiny and the couch looked a bit dirty. As I said above, the "king bed" is actually 2 beds put together, so didn't make for a very comfortable nights sleep for me who had to sleep in the middle. The view was very uninspiring... it is doubled doored though which keeps the noise out. The rooms come with basic kitchenette facilities which was very handy. They also charge you a $200 security deposit, which they then credit back some days after you check out. This was annoying as I only have a debit card, not a credit card so was short on money until they refunded me. It also wasn't mentioned at the time of booking. There were only 2 positive things about my stay here - the staff were fantatic - very friendly & helpful, and the location was great - situated right next door to the aquarium. If you are after a no frills, basic room in a great location, then I would recommend this hotel. I personally wouldn't stay here again unless they upgraded the rooms, there are definitely nicer places within the same price range. To me, the hotel stay is part of the fun of a holiday, and I expected a lot more from Medina Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Medina OK, Lime Cafe (Restaurant) a DEFINITE NO NO”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Premier Grand Studio Room which was ok, however for the price we paid (5 nights) we thought that we would have a much better view (looking into the grey brick wall of the Aquarium). Most of the front desk staff need to lift their game in the personality department and knowledge of the Sydney area would benefit us travellers (if you don't know where places are then how do expect us to know, WE ARE VISITORS TO SYDNEY ON A TIME LIMIT. The staff on the front desk have left lasting impressions on us (not good impressions). DO NOT EAT FROM The Lime Cafe (which is attached to the Medina and menu is left in the room). We went there for dinner on our 2nd last night of our stay, there is not much on the menu to choose from. When asking the waiter what was the fish in the Battered Fish & Chips dish, it seemed that all of a sudden he didn't understand ENGLISH, it was obvious he didn't know and wasn't interested in finding out, we then asked about vegetables and the same again not really wanting to understand. My partner ordered the Battered Fish & Chips & I ordered Spaghetti Bolognaise. The battered fish & chips were obviously straight out of the supermarket freezer, no flavour, terrible. The Spaghetti Bolognaise was terrible no sauce in it, no garlic, where was the cheese, again another frozen meal straight from the supermarket freezer. I had to ask for some parmesan cheese and sauce to give it a bit of ooomph, but nothing would improve the terrible flavour and it had no texture, actually it had nothing at all. What a disgrace, we were so disgusted that these frozen meal dishes could be served in a so called cafe/restaurant in Darling Harbour. To make it worse the two meals cost nearly $50.00 we could have gone to the supermarket heated them up in the microwave oven for about $15.00 what a rip off. We have travelled extensively and in all of that time the two meals that were served up to us in the Lime Cafe were the worst we have ever had. You just never know when a food critic is going to be in your establishment. A bit of advice to the Lime Cafe management and staff, you need to get Gordon Ramsay to show you how to cook a good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location to explore Sydney from”
Reviews.Author: Sturich19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found everything to be good. The room had a decent kitchen, the bathroom was nice and the bed was comfortable. The staff we all friendly and helpful, we arrived at about 7am from the UK and had emailed ahead to get into our room early. Unfortunately it wasn't ready so we came back at 12pm (2 hours before normal checkin) and our bags had been taken upstairs and the room was all ready for us. The best thing about the hotel is the location, its about 30 meters from the habour where you can eat, drink or catch a ferry around to the Circular Quay. (where the bridge and opera house are). Wynard train station is 3 streets away, this has a Coles and Woolworths where you can get groceries etc as we found the local smaller shops really expensive. $7 for some shower get! There are two downsides to this place was 1. the amount of money they charge for the internet - $12 an hour. It was a rip off and 2 the balcony, we had a habour view however when you sit on the chairs on the balcony all you can see is the grey concrete wall which is your balcony. Why they didnt they make the blacony walls out of glass or make them lower? I would recommend this place to friends, it was comfortable and convenient. What more do you need on a city break?

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention to detail and highly improved cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: X_Worldtraveller_X
Reviews.Content: The lobby area as well as the spacious room leaves a good first impression . Unfortunately that's where it ends. After checking in in the morning I wanted to use the pool and sauna. I couldn't use the men's shower as it had a nasty drainage smell. There where no fresh towels either and I had to remove 3 plastic cups out of the sauna. There are no bath ropes or slippers in the room for this occasion and no lockers in the pool or gym area. The sofa had white stains ..(!) , the lounge table hadn't been wiped but the worst fact was that the bed sheets had stains. I've also noticed a few fluff/lint balls on the in the hotel corridor which where still there 2 days later.. Overall the hotel is too filthy for a 4 star hotel and needs urgently to improve not only the level of cleanliness but also paying good attention to detail. On a positive note the sound-absorbing double glassing leaves the busy city noises outside and gives you a good night sleep (if you have quite neighbours that is)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Travelleroz888
Reviews.Content: The room is terrible. The bed old and no longer provide support. The room was noisy and we can hear the neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff great - restaurant staff disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RockyDarwin
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the property and it really is the perfect location. This stay I had a studio apartment which I really enjoyed - it is pretty much open plan with sliding doors that can block off the bedroom. I found it really comfortable and had everything I needed for my stay. I think the proeprty needs a few touch ups - there were lots of scuff marks but everything worked and it was comfortable so no complaints there. The hotel staff were very pleasant however the only disapoointment for me is the restaurant staff. I am not sure if the restaurant is seperate to the hotel but there is a big difference in the level of service between reception and restaurant. I had breakfast and it seemed like an effort for the staff to take my order - like I was interupting their morning coffee. I ordered srambled eggs with mushrooms and was very disappointed when I recieved tinned champignons - I think this is false advertising and they need to look at what they are offering on their menu - if I had of know they were not fresh mushrooms I would not have ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great studio apartment”
Reviews.Author: Andersea Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Great stay in comfortable studio - washing machine and drier were useful after travelling elsewhere and great to have kitchen facilities including dishwasher even though we only used them for breakfast - convenience store round the corner for juice, milk bread etc. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Can find better value for money”
Reviews.Author: StephanieH1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in a one bedroom apartment. Booked the hotel for the location and because we also required a balcony. On arrival at 2:45pm we were told there was no hotel parking available (all booked out) yet we could park a couple of blocks up. This was extremely inconvenient. All websites stated parking was $32 per night, but we were charged $40 because the carpark didnt belong to medina. On checkout I mentioned this to a different receptionist who told me that parking should have definitely stayed at $32. Our room was on the first floor and our balcony overlooked a busy laneway and road. It was extremely noisy. The mini bar was ridiculously overpriced. $7.50 for a chocolate bar. for the prive Medina charges, I would book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but it's location makes it essential”
Reviews.Author: MagicFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only just after the New Year and it is a very spacious, well presented apartment with all the essentials for a stay. It has a small kitchen, and a very small concrete balcony (we were on the aquarium side) which enabled us to see Darling Harbour (just!). The balcony only had 1 chair, so we didn't sit out, but it was nice enough elsewhere in the apartment. Please be advised that there is a convenience store underneath the hotel which has most food, including pizza, which suited us fine. There is also a bottle shop there too. One gripe we did have was that on arrival, we were sent away at 1.00 because the room wasn't ready, and told to return at 2.00. On return at 2.00 the room was still not ready and we were told to sit in reception area and wait. No apology, no timescale, which is not very friendly. We were there half an hour - so be aware that your room may not be ready for when they say it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good and that's where it stops”
Reviews.Author: Kazza59
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good if you are looking to be close to Darling Habour. Apart from the Hotel's cafe Lime, where the service was exceptionally bad, there is nothing close by for breakfast. The fire alarm went off twice during the night. The air conditioning didnt work for the first two nights despite my complaints and was finally fixed for the 3rd and 4th night stay. Rooms are adequate, however the pillows were old and although four were provided no two were the same, and I am sure you could find better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and apartment had everything I needed to make my 12 nights in Sydney extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireHatters
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 week stay watching 5th Ashes Test Match. Apartment was roomy and a real home from home and being able to cook and wash clothes was a real plus. All staff helpful and friendly - cleaning staff brilliant. Pool small and internet expensive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for city & darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: audreylou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the Kings Street Wharf end of Darling Harbour, behind Sydney Wildife World - so great location for Darling Harbour attractions and restaurants, short walk to QVB and not too far from Wynyard station - so a great location. Rooms pretty good - decent size, clean etc - nothing too special but perfect for our girls weekend in Sydney. Staff pretty helpful. Didn't try the onsite restaurant (with so many other great options nearby - why would you?!). Pool area smallish but looked really pleasant - again we didn't try it as were there on a wet weekend. There are 2 small grocery stores in the same block, so easy to pick up supplies for breakfast in the room, and also a bottle shop very close by for pre-dinner drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DestinationUnkown03 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Having previously lived in Sydny for three years we know the area well and this hotel was in the perfect location for us. Within a short distance of Darling Harbour bars and restaurants and George and Pitt street for shopping and transport. They were comfortable, clean and quiet rooms and the second time we stayed we had a self-contained apartment with a washer and dryer. Perfect for catching up on all the washing! Staff were very friendly and helpful. So it was a pleasant stay and very reasonably priced for Sydney. Would certainly recommend and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: smurray2006
Reviews.Content: Loved the room. Had a nice balcony. Very clean. The location is great. Can hop on the ferry in 2 minutes walk. Front desk very helpful and courteous. Nice pool, small gym, and sauna. Turn on the sauna 10 min prior to use. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but strange - definitely not up to 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: KHBermuda
Reviews.Content: This should have been an ideal spot for my wife and I to spend our 6 days in Sydney. Good location, 1 bedroom apartment setup, 4 star rating. Some very strange things though to make you aware of. The only rooms they had available for us were wheelchair accessible (apparently as they were replacing carpets on one floor during our stay). While it's commendable to have such rooms available, they weren't actually built that well for those confined to wheelchairs or otherwise. The first issues were with the kitchen setup (really low cabinets making the cabinet and sink very awkward when cooking and very limited counter space), and the bathroom (very high toilet, to the point my wife's feet wouldn't touch the floor - she's 5'6", not terribly short). The first bathroom we got also didn't have any lip in the shower, which resulted in the coating the bathroom with a couple inches of water unless you built a dam with towels (unfortunately also no extra towels available so this wasn't effective). The bed we had the first night (before switching rooms) was the absolute worst I've ever slept in at a hotel. Mattresses were soft, as were the boxsprings. They weren't really boxsprings, just pieces of foam that sat just above the floor. The mattress must have been really old and worn out, there was no support whatsoever. We switched rooms on the second day and the bed went from terrible to barely adequate. The fridge in the room went from having cracked shelves in the first room that wouldn't support any weight, to having a door that wouldn't close, so we'd wake up to water on the floor every morning, and our food would be covered with water from the condensation. On the positive the service was excellent. Felt like a case where the hotel owners were nickel and diming on materials and the management was working with what they had, but didn't have capability to replace/repair things that needed upgrade (beds) or repairs (fridges). The location was prime, we were right on the harbour beside the acquarium, with many pubs and restaurants nearby. We were also very near the Imax theatre. However, the problems with the rooms were a huge disappointment and definitely put a damper on our honeymoon to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: RockyDarwin
Reviews.Content: Travelling for buisness with some colleagues I booked us all into this property. Location is fabulous - easy walk to a variety of restaurants in Darling Harbour and to the CBD shopping (it's uphill going there but leisurely downhill on the way back!) and also right next door to Aquarium and Wildlife World. I even walked to Circular Quay (about 20 minutes). I could not fault the housekeeping and front office staff that I came into contact with - service was prompt, efficient and very friendly. A big thumbs up from me and my colleagues! The apartments were comfortable, clean and had a great size balcony. Room service has limited hours but they offer a meal delivery service and there are a couple of 24 hour convenience stores near by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: bunn107
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November & I booked 2 rooms in advance. I requested 1 bdrm Queen Studio apartments. The hotel is small but fantastic. Non- smoking, very clean, with ajoining cafe, pool & gym & very clean toilets in the lobby area. One problem was that Ben at check-in did not explain why he held onto $1,900.00 on my credit card, when my total bill was under $1,500.00. This made me angry as I understand $100 fee but $400 left me without $300 of my own money towards spending. This is my ONLY complaint. However after talking to a very helpfull lady on the desk named Charlotte, she manage to fix my request. She was outstanding & a credit to the hotel. After a lot of searching reviews online I chose this hotel as I just didnt want to spill straight onto the city street with noise, cars, smoking etc. The hotel is city side of Darling Harbour so no long trek just to cross the bridge to the city. The views were awsome of Darling Harbour & due to being in Shelley St, which vitually had no traffic our cab could always pull up outside with no drama. The rooms / studios were great very clean, spacious and with a balcony I could open to for fresh air, instead of aircon which affects my sinus. They had a kitchenette with large fridge and microwave. The bathroom was lovely and had a washing machine & dryer (very handy). As well as a TV in the lounge there was a TV in the bedroom. This hotel offers excellent value for money along with a fantastic location. Next block down is a 24 hour 7/11 store And literally 1 minute to cross the street & you hit a row of resturants, cafes & bars at King St Wharf. Also the ferry connection to Circular Quay. Walk the other direction & 1 minute later you have hit the Wildlife & Aquarium worlds not to mention more resturants & bars. Five minutes walk & we have hit Sydney Imax. Keep walking & in 5 more minutes more resturants along with shopping centre joining the other hotels opposite side of Darling Harbour. Keep walking south 5 minutes & you hit the Chinese Gardens then Paddys Markets. All without having to cross busy streets with traffic & I felt very safe walking the whole Darling Harbour precinct. Again excellent value for money and excellent location. This is my first choice whenever I stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The location is fabulous but the service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: crashburny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a part of our trip down the East Coast. The location of this place is great. A few minutes walk and you're at the Aquarium, Wild Life Center, lots of restaurants and bars, Imax and so on. Our room was very nice except that the dishwasher didn't work properly and there was an empty baby bottle from previous guests under a sofa which felt to us like our room didn't get thorougly vacuumed before we got it...The car parking felt expensive to us with 32$ and there was no free Wifi. We've stayed in lots of hotels and serviced appartments already and what stood out a bit was the attitude of the employees at the reception. They weren't particularly friendly and made us feel like we were a nuisance rather then customers... Overall we can recommend the place if you're looking for a great location and comfortable and modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space in a good location but no WIFI”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Madina over New Years mainly because it was the cheapest place that we could find (still $400 an night though) and were really happy with what we got; obviously the price was inflated due to the date, the hotel is certainly not worth that rate in itself. The rooms are spacious and well maintained; the location is very good for most of the main attractions in Sydney as they are in easy walking distance. The hotel is next to Australia Wild and the Sydney Aquarium and there are plenty of harbour front bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. The only problem we had was that they do not have WIFI, instead you need a cable to plug into the network point next to the desk, this is inconvenient for three reasons, firstly as a couple we both carry laptops on holiday and may both want to use the internet at the same time, secondly smart phones need WIFI unless you want a big data bill and thirdly there is no actual cable in the room, you have to pay a deposit to get these from reception and they did not have enough for each room so we had to go out and buy one. If you are going to be here at a peak time make sure you take your own. If you rely on a mobile device that needs WIFI donâ€™t book here.

Reviews.Title: “BAD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Aussiekidd
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again, after having poor service from the moment I walked into the door and the whole stay, When I booked the hotel on the medina website it said one bedroom appartment with a view of Darling Harbour, and after reading all the great reviews on here I had a reasonable expectation, so it came as a shock when I arrived there was no help with my bags as they could see me and my wife struggle to get in the door the receptionist called (Ben) just stared and then looked back down on the computer screen and didn't acknowledge my wife or I, so I walked up to the receptionist and he explained to me that the room that I had booked was incorrect to what they had in there system and in there system it said studio grand appartment, and then basically Ben the receptionist keeped saying that it was the reservationist at fault, and to me this was very unprofessional, and then he said he won't be able to upgrade my room type untill the next day due to the availability, at that point we had no other option but to take the room available, and once we got into the room the furniture was very old and had stains the room smelt like someone had smoked in it previously and most of the lights in the room wasn't working. I then called down to reception that same night and asked if I could have some extra towels and could I get someone to replace the lights not working, ben the receptionist replied how Many people are in your room, and it was just my wife and I, and I told him that and he said ok I'll get some up to you softly..... 1 hour went by and still no one had come, I called reception a 2nd time and asked politely if he knew when the lights would be fixed and the extra towels and, with no appologie he replied "they will be up shortly" and 30minutes went by and still nothing so for the 3rd time I called Down, I explained to him nothing has been done and I would like for it to be down now as I have requested over and over.... Finally the porter came up and fixed it, anyways we where very un' happy about the service so we just decided to check out the next day and stay at another hotel, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - try to get upgraded”
Reviews.Author: belindacoles
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 4 week trip to Australia, we had previously spent 10 days in Sydney at the beginning of our trip, where we stayed with friends. We spent a long time researching hotels in Sydney trying to find a good location and good price, overall the Medina does well for this and is good value for money given its location. Our room was upgraded from a studio to an apartment free of charge and it was a welcomed suprise and probably made our stay much more enjoyable. The room was lovely, very spacious and modern and we could have happily spent more time here. The hotel positioning doesnt really give amazing views, but you can get some views of darling harbour. For location the hotel is good, it is located right in the hub of darling harbour, literally next door to the aquarium, so there is plenty of choice for dining and evening enterntainment close by. Its a little bit out from some of the other city attractions, but if you dont mind a stroll or using the transport system in Sydney then its a great base for a stay. There is a monorail station next to the Aquarium. The pool at the hotel was small but nice, we didnt really get to use it due to bad weather, but it looked nice.
