As a few other reviews have mentioned, we also had curdled milk in our fridge, which when mentioned to the staff, they werent very apologetic. The staff slighlty let this hotel down. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a mid-budget base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly poor”
Reviews.Author: tallan_os
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom apartment while in Sydney for work. After reading the other reviews on here I expected a nice place but was really disappointed the room I got. The first thing I noticed was that the orange sofa in the lounge was covered in some rather dodgy looking stains. Looks like someone had more fun in that room than I did... The bed had a very thin doona which made it chilly over night as the weather was bad, and when I went to use the iron, I found it had exposed wires and the base of the iron was badly damaged and unusable. My other complaint was that the main living area of the apartment only had net curtains, and faced the street whereby people could look in. Not a huge problem but I would prefer curtains that I can close for privacy. The location of the hotel is great and I imagine other rooms were probably better than the one I ended up in, but I'll be trying some other options before I go back to Medina.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PJPTallahassee
Reviews.Content: A great apartment hotel. The apartment includes a fully equipped kitchen and even a washer and dryer in the bathroom. Best of all is the location. It is one block from Darling Harbour, across the street from the Aquarium and about a ten minute walk to Chinatown and to George St. with all the best shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCork
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to base yourself for a stay in Sydney. We stayed in a premier grand studio apartment which was fantastic; there was a large sitting room, a full galley kitchen, a bathroom which contained a washing machine and dryer, and a bedroom that was separated from the sitting from with full length screens. It is just on darling harbour with restaurants, shops, the aquarium, IMAX and much more within a short stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: We booked 10 nights at the Grand Harbourside in a premier view one bedroom apartment and couldn't have been more pleased. We were caught up in the flight disruption due to the Icelandic volacano so had to stay another 10 nights, we were equally delighted with all aspects of the Grand Harbourside. My advice would be to go for a premier view as some of the apartments are at the back overlooking the road and some on the side overlooking the aquarium. We were on the fifth floor with a large balcony that caught the sun and great views overlooking Darling Harbour. Yes, it is next to Cargo bar and nightclub and Friday and Saturday nights do get a bit mucky but the sound proofing is great and when the windows were closed we hardly heard a sound. The apartments are well furnished with balcony tables and chairs, dining table with 4 chairs, sofa and arm cair etc. Bathroom is fine and the kitchen facilities in the one bedroom apartment more than adequate for cooking in or just snacking and using the many restaurants in the vicinity. I couldn't fault the staff, they were attentive, polite and friendly so I am not sure about some of the other reviewers' comments - we had no complaints at all. We could have our room serviced every day if we wanted or for more privacy, just put out the rubbish and wet towels for them to be replaced. The best of both worlds and it was always service with a smile. The location is very good, you literally walk onto Darling Harbour with a whole array of bars and restuarants and the ferry stop is next to the hotel. It is a 5 minute walk into the centee of Sydney and all in all the Grand Habourside has lots going for it. On our first night return to Sydney we stayed at another central apartment but we couldn't wait to get back to the Grand Harbourside and as soon as they had a room available we moved straight back to the original apartment we had on our first visit. The restaurant Lime is part of the hotel and serves drinks and light meals and these can be charged to the room account. The fitness suite looked OK but I didn't use it and the swimming pool, despite being small was always clean and had a grassy area for sunbathing. We were fortunate to catch the Anzac Parade on the Sunday and it was most impressive and showed the pride Australia has in its armed forces. I lasted 3 hours and was meticulously managed - Australia can show Britain a thing or two about pride, national identity and respect for its armed services! There are lots of restaurants to choose from, our favourite was Zaffran which is the other side of Darling Harbour, about a 10 minute walk. Modern Indian cuisine which was stunning, particularly sat on the balcony. The attitude of 'The Malaya', almost next door to the apartments, highly rated for food was not good and after confronting a haughty manageress we walked out before ordering and went next door to Kobe Jones, an upmarket Japanese which was great. For cheap and cheerful there is Wagamama next to the apartments which serves good food in a fairly basic setting but it doesn't break the bank. Hurricane's, also the other side of Darling Harbour serves ribs etc. Food was OK but not spectacular for the price. If you want a drink and pub style steak, Cargo is literally 15 seconds from the apartments but best used lunchtime or early evening in the week - avoid at weekend evenings. Also just along the wharf is Bungalow 8, again very busy at week-ends but pleasant for a drink but the food wasn't that good. Probaby the best deal we found was at 'The Argyle' in The Rocks, just abouve Circular Quay. On a Tuesday you have 2 steak and chips for 16 dollars - this was fillet steak and a really good meal and all it cost was about Â£5 a person- well worth a visit on a Tuesday (served all day). If you want fish and chips get a bus out to Balmoral Beach where the take away serves the freshest fish and chips, we preferred it to the fish market where we had lunch one day. You can sit on a bench to eat it overlooknig a stunning beach - fabulous! All in all, despite the frustration of being stuck in Sydney because of cancellel flights, staying at the Grand Harbourside made up for it and ensured that our extended stay was as painless as possible. When we return to Sydney later in the year we will be heading for the Grand Harbourside in hopefully the same apartment. The flexibility and extra space beats a hotel hands down if you have more than a few nights to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: heathway53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina Grand Harbourside for 8 nights in March for a combination of a family wedding and holiday. The apartment we were allocated was on the 4th floor overlooking the aquarium and a side view of Darling Harbour. The apartment was very comfortable, well designed and suited our needs really well. We were able to come and go as we pleased - the only catering we did was breakfast. it was very handy for all the sights, but it was quite a long walk to the ferry port, though taxis were really easy to get. There were plenty of local restaurants, convenience stores, which made life easy. It was good that the hotel had triple glazing - it was very noisy when the windows were open. When closed - we didnt hear a thing. The only criticism was the quality of the Broadband service. I had to work whilst there and used the Medina's broadband service - not cheap. During office hours the broadband was very slow and sometimes wouldnt even connect to the internet. The service improved in the evenings and weekends. One other comment is that Brits visiting Sydney will find everything very expensive. We are used to London prices, but Sydney beat them hands down. No doubt due to the strong Aussie Dollar and what seems to be a lack of recession over there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: Daniel021
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medina Grand Harbourside for 4 nights, traveling with my wife and (almost) 2 year old daughter. Upon arrival, we struggled to carry our large and heavy bags up the steps to reception but were offered no assistance from the several staff members who could clearly see us and were not otherwise occupied. When checking in, the staff member at the desk tried very hard to make us pay again for our stay, even though we had already pre-paid 100% as this was the requirement when booking a special internet-only rate. On a more positive note, the room was large and well appointed, and the location of the hotel was absolutely perfect for our needs (walking distance to Darling Harbour shops and attractions). We would stay here again, but would not hold very high hopes for attentive or professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Harbour view”
Reviews.Author: shahzadyusuf
Reviews.Content: Wow what a view!! I bet this is the first reaction of everybody who goes to this hotel for the first time. Never knew Sydney harbour looks so beatifull from top. Will not mind staying agin though it is bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with extra space”
Reviews.Author: JaneKR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of February prior to a cruise leaving from Wharf 8. Booked premier studio, but upgraded on arrival to 1 bedroom apartment on 1st floor overlooking Darling Harbour/King St Wharf. Apartment was clean and modern furnishings with a great balcony space. Despite location the apartment was very quiet. King St Wharf great for bars/cafes/restaurants - no major roads to cross and all within walking distrance. As are the Aquarium, ferry service and monorail. Didnt use the kitchen facilities, except for tea/coffee and fridge for wine, however washer/dryer really handy for pre-cruise laundry. On check out walked cases the 300m to Wharf 8 - couldnt have been easier. Rates were comparable to our previously Darling Harbour hotel, but with the extra space and amenities. Will definitely stay here again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: NickypKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a studio apartment. Very impressed. The whole hotel has and is still being refurbished. Our room had a sink with toaster, fridge and cutlery. Enough to make breakfast/snacks. The room was stylish and had a brand new bed, carpet and curtains. Our balcony overlooked Darling Harbour and as we arrived on Australia Day we had the best seats in town for the fireworks which where spectacular. I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay here again....Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: woo63
Reviews.Content: Whilst location was very good, the standard of service was apalling. Twice we were given curdled milk (not nice in your coffee!!!), the airconditoning in our room only went on one temp -COLD, and sounded like a freight train coming through our room. We asked on 3 occasions for a serviceman to fix it but were ignored every day. On our fourth day water started pouring through the bathroom light fitting from the aircon. Upon advising reception, we were simply advised to turn it off and suffer the heat for the next 3 days. Note it was a very hot & humid week, and the studio unit was very small so extremly hot & stuffy. They sent a porter to have a look, who checked the kitchen cupboards (what the????) and left,. WE could not bear the heat so left the unit running until the next day when they finally relented and gave us (grudgngly) another room. Rooms were not serviced, and it took until 3pm each day before we could get fresh towels. At NZ$400 per night I expected much better standards than this. I might add throughout the whole stay reception staff were very disinterested in guests and no idea how to offer good friendly customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not child/ baby friendly”
Reviews.Author: Morgs2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 8 month old baby recently stayed at the Medina Harbourside and after booking the room on-line, I phoned the hotel directly to request a portacot. I was informed that I would need to pay an additional $5 a night for the cot (which I thought was a bit steep considering most hotels provide a complimentary portacot) nevertheless, I agreed to paying the $5 as I had already booked and paid for the room on line. When we arrived, the portacot wasn't set up and after 30mins of waiting (with a hungry and tired baby) and staff member arrived to set the cot up. Once he made the bed and left, I inspected the cot only to realise that the mattress didn't belong with the cot, which meant that there was a 10cm gap at one of the ends. The mattress was also rock hard. I phoned reception, explained the problem and requested another cot and a blanket to pad the mattress. Another cot arrived probably 20 mins later which appeared to have been from the 80's. Two of the four corners were torn just above the mattress, that meant that a child or baby could easily get their leg or arm caught (which is a huge safety risk). I decided not to phone reception again however, I advised reception upon checking out, only to informed that she would "Make a note of it'. No apology was given nor was my $5 refunded. I also noticed during our stay that the grass hadn't been cut in quite a while in the pool area, and the pool itself was freezing cold (although the website claimed that it was a 'heated pool'). The pool area seemed unkept. Overall, our stay was disappointing and I had a sleepless night as I had to keep checking that my baby hadn't fallen through the holes in the portacot. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute disappointment, filthy & theft to boot!”
Reviews.Author: nadssa
Reviews.Content: celebrating our engagement our first night we found two large fresh stains on our quilt cover. we reported the problem immediately to be given a replacement double quilt for a queen sized bed, which we accepted at 1am. Five hours after check out we remembered leaving two expensive items of clothing in the closet, we called immediately to arrange pick up of the items. After three days of phonecalls chasing management, the items were "not located" and i was asked if i had unpacked my suitcase yet and was i sure the items were missing?! No compensation or apology was offered. upon discussion with the unsympathetic & unhelpful manager she said the best she could do would be a discount on our next stay..............Seriously?!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Can't say the same about the service!”
Reviews.Author: SouthAussieDave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after taking up a really good offer from Toga Hospitality so it seems a bit rude to have to raise a few complaints. Checking in was a breeze with all our details already on the booking form and needing only a signature it was a speedy process. I noticed a sign on the counter saying that upgrades were available for $20 per night. As to be expected for the price, our room was VERY small so I rang reception to see if an upgrade was available. The female receptionist said there was one available and she would send a porter straight up. Not wanting to disturb anyhting in the room we just sat on a chair and waited. And waited. And waited. After half an hour my wife went down to see what was happening only to find out that the girl who took the call had gone home and they would have to see what they could do. After more phone calls they offered a room for an extra $70 per night which we declined saying that we had been offered one for $20. She said that these were all gone now!!! To cut a long story short we finally got a room for the offered rate after a long and frustrating wait. We also needed parking for the night ($30 which is a bit steep) and were told just to park anywhere in the carpark and leave the keys with them. Only to find out that there were no parking spaces available. More calls to reception. Park anywhere and they'll sort it out if the car needed shifting. Came back in the morning to find a note attached to the car from the hotel saying that we should have made arrangements to park there. We had - 3 times!! And as for the chocolates I had preordered? They didn't appear at all. The location is great and the room we got eventually was good so if they improve their 'service' then it would be a first rate accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Would go back tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: ianjm2
Reviews.Content: As I was staying in Sydney for a week I had high hopes for the Medina Harbourside and it didn't let me down. I absolutely loved the apartment, it was a home from home. The apartment had a well equipped kitchen, great lounge area and a large bathroom. We also had a balcony and could see Darling Harbour to our right. To get to the centre of Sydney was easy, you can get the ferry from outside the aquarium next door and take it to Circular Quay. This gives you great views across the harbour. The Medina Harbourside also has a gym and a pool which we found great after being out for the day. The only down side to the Medina is that it is next to the Western Highway which is noisey if you are on the balcony but you can't hear it once inside the apartment. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: lil_alice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina Grand Harbourside for 6 nights at the beginning of December. We had a one bedroom apartment on the top floor with a city view. We normally stay at the Oaks whilst in Australia, but to be honest, the Medina Grand Harbourside surpassed any of the Oaks we have stayed in. The apartment was fantastic - very clean and modern. Not huge, but it had everything we needed in it - a desk area, dining table, lounge, kitchen, bathroom, laundry and bedroom. The apartments are in a fantastic location, directly next door to the aquarium and a short walk to Darling Harbour and the ferry points. When next in Sydney we won't hesitate - we'll be staying here again ! Alison and Mark

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for site seeing”
Reviews.Author: StephanieR4
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - 1 bedroom apartment - kitchen, sitting area, washer and dryer in bathroom. Could see Darling Harbour from the bedroom window.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Stay, OK Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Tistybus
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Medina because the location is perfect for King Streets bars and restaurants. Check-in and customer service was fine. The apartment allocated to us was on the first floor, which was a bit disappointing view-wise, but was sufficiently insulated from road noise through double glazed windows. We had a bit of a water view and didn't spend much time in the apartment anyway. The apartment had a balcony, lounge, kitchen and dining, with separate bathroom and bedroom. We requested, and were granted, two single beds (I love my sister, but I'm not going to share a bed with her!) which were not plush, but not uncomfortable either. The pool and surrounds were nice for the location - you don't often get outdoor pools in the city. Towels were plentiful but the shower room adjoining the pool area could have done with some toiletries. I paid $230, which was OK value for money. If breakfast had been chucked in, I would have felt better about the cost. If you want to be close to Darling Harbour and King St wharf, I would recommend this hotel. For Circular Quay and shopping, I would recommend something located further toward the centre of the city. Oh, and parking will cost you an additional $30 per night. I opted out of that one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: MissAfternoonDelight
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Apartment was a reasonable size, with comfy couches and bed. Also had a kitchen and full sized fridge, washer and dryer. View wasn't fantastic, over the Aquarium and a busy road, but still a nice location in a big city. Reasonably close to Wynyard station for public transport options. Only a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay where ferries depart from. Could do with a repaint and some mould on the shower screen, but very nice and comfortable on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sydney, so central & great views”
Reviews.Author: brisbanebased
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in October & we had a fantastic time. The rooms are really modern, one of the staff told us they had just been updated. The best part of the stay was our view, we paid a little extra to get a 'harbour view' apartment and it was well worth the money. We had a balcony that over looked the Sydney Aquarium & Darling Harbour. Our room was an apartment so we had a full kitchen & even a laundry with plenty of space in the lounge area. The rooms were nice & clean and they were serviced and made up every day. The front desk staff were really helpful, they gave us maps to get around and gave us some recommendations of what to see and where to go. We have already booked to go back to this Hotel for January it was so impressive. We won't be staying in standard style Hotel's anymore, this is by far a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cost is barely justifiable by location only. Definitely not worth it for the service, rooms or amenities.”
Reviews.Author: kickkwok
Reviews.Content: One half of our group arrived a couple of days earlier than the second half of the group. On arrival the check in staff appeared to be very efficient, attentive and used initiative, suggesting he should enable our room key cards access to the different floors on which our entire group would be staying. Unfortunately we had to return to reception numerous times throughout our stay, as access to the different levels and even access to our rooms was never consistent. There appears to be a huge lack communication between staff. Our freezer wasn't working on arrival, which was essential in order to provide ice cubes to cool our baby milk. I called down to reception twice before they finally came to fix it. 2 days later, a porter came to the room to ask 'if our freezer was working yet?' The television in our 'living room' would not even turn on, and we only had the 'old' remote control. A member of staff came to the room and said 'i don't know how to work these things either' and promised to pass the message onto the day staff. The next night we called reception again enquiring after a working television, having been out all day, and another member of staff arrived to announce 'these tvs are new, we haven't been trained' Our 'pedal bin' in the bathroom had a broken pedal, which normally wouldn't be in issue however, we have a small baby, and hence had to throw away alot of nappies, and found it inconvenient and unhygienic to have to keep lifting the lid of the bin by hand. (it was a very small bin, so also hard to reach esp when holding a baby!) On reporting this to reception, they promptly asked housekeeping to remove the bin, and a porter returned some hours later to replace it...with a light bulb?? (I still don't understand the logic behind that?) We never did get a replacement, and had to make do with a carrier bag we put out ourselves each day. We also had to be very careful with what was left out on the kitchenette top, as our microwavable steriliser bag for baby bottles, which were clearly labelled (by Lindam) was thrown away by housekeeping. Luckily our last bag was safely left in our suitcase! The room itself was spacious enough, however the decor was very 'tired' looking. Faux fur seats were worn right down to the lining, sofas almost threadbare. The only new thing, the tv, wasn't even functional. The location was very useful, a stones throw away from Darling Park monorail should u need to use it, and just a few blocks from chinatown, which is an easy walk even with a baby. It is also right next to the harbour, and the aquarium. They advertise 'a fitness gym, sauna and heated pool'. The fitness gym comprises of very dated one exercise bike, cross trainer and some free weights. The pool is slightly heated, barely noticeable, and cleanliness is questionable. (leaves in the pool and the water was salty) The sauna barely heated up at all. Again access was variable, as was exiting! Liked best: Location Liked least: Poor service and decor. In need of serious training and updating. Would recommend only if location was paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expectations”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on TA we thought this would be an adequate choice for a few days stay in Sydney. As noted in other reviews its not on the Habourside but as long as you aware of it its not an unpleasant surprise. Its also right next to the Motorway, so make sure you don't get a room on the city side. Though the hotel has thoughtfully installed double sets of double glazing -you certainly need it. When we checked in the very pleasant receptionist recommended we upgrade for a nominal cost. We are glad we did. It was closer to the habour side and had more room and extra amenities like a washer and dryer which were handy. The room was well equipped. Though the TV in bed room was at a ridiculous viewing angle because of the configuration of the room - just as well we didn't want to watch TV in bed. Plenty of space in the room, with lots of natural light. Cleaned well each day to considering the size of the room. It was a short walk to darling harbour or the city. All the staff were very helpful which helped to make the stay enjoyable. didn't try the restaurant. put hand in pool but didn't seem too heated

Reviews.Title: “A fully equiped and highly modern apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulandGail
Reviews.Content: We were amazed when we walked into this apartment. We had got it at a good rate so didn't expect too much but it was excellent. The bed was huge! The bathroom was lovely (and has a cupboard which houses a washing machine and tumble dryer). The kitchen has a full oven and hob, huge fridge, dishwasher etc. Both the bedroom and living room have plasma tvs (but no sky channels). It's situated in Darling Habour about 1 minute from the Aquarium. The staff were very friendly and helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimately very good”
Reviews.Author: rosieb
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 bedrooms for 6 nights. When we arrived we found that the children's room was better. They had 2 single beds which equated to a queen sized bed while we had an Australian double, which wasnt even good quality. Further, the children had the 'kitchen' area. This wasnt an ideal setup and to their credit the manager moved us - an upgrade. So, my husband and I moved to a lower floor and the girls stayed put. During the night a heavy picture fell off the wall onto my younger daughter's bed - fortunately she wasnt hurt. My older daughter slept on the couch - bed too old to support her. Again, the management listened and acted. The girls were moved to a room next to ours - and we all settled well. On check out we were billed for an inhouse movie which we didnt watch. Again, they accepted our word and it was removed from the bill. So, the moral of the tale is Medina was found wanting in some areas and it responded professionally and appropriately. Great location. Close to 711 Supermarket; ferry, monorail, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Darling Harbour amenities”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: This provides a great, spacious alternative to the traditional hotel room option, Our room was very clean and the windows offered excellent sound proofing from the busy roads outside. Convenience shops are also nearby as well as an array of restaurants etc. and the Sydney Convention Centre We also think it represented good value for money at 150$AU per night in August 2009, though deals are cheaper through wofit.com than with the hotel directly. Niggle would be about the fact that one of the receptionists entered our room while my partner was home, apparently to 'show' another couple what the room looked like. He apparently thought the room was empty but this gave my partner a real fright. I know this was probably an honest mistake but the reception team really should know which rooms are occupied. They are no security chains/privacy locks on the door either to prevent this kind of thing happening. In addition, room service seems a bit over zealous. If you put the do not disturb sign on the door, they call you to ask if you need anything. I know this is probably well meaning, but when your body is still in a European time zone the last thing you need it being wakened despite a DND sign. Besides these relatively minor niggles, I would definitely consider Medina Grand Harbourside if I was visiting Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: jancolsun
Reviews.Content: great hotel, fabulous location in Darling harbour, perfect for being a tourist. Easy access to all the harbour attractions, shops and restaurants within easy walk, Aquarium virtually next door . Hotel was good, room comfortable and clean. Fairly expensive but everything in Sydney is!. Over all good place to base yourself from to enjoy the harbour and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GAmomofboys
Reviews.Content: The staff was always smiling and incredibly helpful. A morning paper was delivered every morning. Our room was cleaned every day. We chose a room with a kitchen, which was fully equipped for cooking on the stove top, in the oven, microwave. Dishwasher and washing machine/dryer was also in room. The furniture was in great condition. The balcony had lounge chairs and a table w/chairs for eating, card playing & relaxing. We didn't swim, but the pool was very clean and warm. It is in an excellent location - we enjoyed our morning walks across the bridge into the CBD and other sites; or we stayed on the Harbourside and enjoyed the restaurants, aquarium, Star City, etc. If I ever return to Australia, I will book here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: linzlinz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one-bedroom apartment that was new and modern and very clean. The features were great, you had your own climate control for AC and heating, a fully contained kitchen, a nice big bath, laundry, TV in house movies, a stereo and balcony which was a bonus for smokers. The location was nice and quiet by day and on the weekend came alive especially at night with nightclubs, loungeâ€™s, cafes and restaurants were busy. It was very close to Sydney harbour cruise boats and water taxi's. There are handy little mini-marts and bottle shops close by. Itâ€™s a great area for doing the tourist thing!!! We got the monorail into the city, which is 3-minute walk away. I would recommend this place to stay it was enjoyable. Just one thing *The staff could have been nicer and friendlier at times.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: travellingjuan
Reviews.Content: I only found this on a last minute web site. We used the internet cafe on George Street and booked this the same day we arrived. The price was very cheap, but I think it was because it was a last minute deal. This is not a hotel, it is an apartment complex but it is 50 meters from the harbor and it fantastic. The best thing is it had a kitchen and clothes machine to wash the clothes. This made the trip a lot cheaper and a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBANNISTER
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a grand studio it was clean, modern and quiet. Has a good sized kitchen with full size fridge and full size bath. There are sliding doors around the bed so you can screen it off to create a seperate bedroom and lounge which was fab as I used the lounge for a last minute business meeting and it was much more presentable with the bed screeded off. Great location on the city side of Darling harbour so you can stroll over to the city in 2 mins! The balcony was a great extra even though noisy with the doors open it was worth it. Staff were excellent, they found me a phone charger, gave me fab bar reccomendation (very close to the hotel, The Loft) and provided me with CDs and ice late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: contractreports
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio room, admittedly their lowest rate and so did not have view over the water of course but found the room to be very small. I would have checked out had I been there more than one night. It does not represent value for money. The location is great for being in the centre of the city but King St wharf was very quiet the night I stayed with almost no.one in any of the restaurants but it was very beautiful to walk in the whole area. Definitely clean, functional but wouldn't return and staff not particularly helpful or friendly unless pushed. No restaurant, but breakfast is available in connecting cafe where staff are very sloppy and not sufficient to cater for hotel guests and regular office workers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great View”
Reviews.Author: doclam
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have a room on the side of the hotel with a great view and balcony of Darling Harbour. Our room was nicely furnished and comfortable. The hotel has nice amenities in the fitness room and pool. It is not directly on the Harbour, but a very short walk across the street to great restaurants and cafes. It would pay to ask if for a corner room or room with harbour view if availible. I would also recommend using the wine shop on the street level in the same block or duty free coming in through the airport as the room came with a small refrigerator to save using the mini-bar. I also liked the micro-brewery on Darling Harbour just down from the hotel. Finally a trip to the Syndey fish market for some of the freshest seafood is great walk or ride the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Stimpy_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over new year. The location of the hotel was absolutely superb within a few hundred meters of all the restaurants and bars on Darling Harbour and easy access to the monorail to take you into the city centre. The room was extremely spacious and immaculately clean. The rooms were stocked with the equivalent of a mini bar however with a convenience store & bottle shop right next to the hotel there was no need to use these as they were quite expensive. We went on a cruise on NYE and it was a 1 minute walk from the wharf that we left from so the location could not have been better. I would recommend this hotel and location to anyone staying in Sydney and I would think you would be hard pressed to get a better one anywhere is Sydney. BRILLIANT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very serviceable apartment, good location, suitable for wheelchair user”
Reviews.Author: Humbugcat
Reviews.Content: We chose the Medina Grand Harbourside apartment hotel for its proximity to King Street Wharf for the period over New Yearâ€™s Eve, as we had booked a NYE cruise on a boat docked at King Street Wharf. As a wheelchair user I did not wish to fight my way through the crowds from any other area of Sydney. I will concentrate on disabled friendly aspects of the property in this review. There is good ramped disabled access at the front of the hotel. The only apartment type available with a walk-in shower is the standard 1-bed apartment. This must be booked specifically as an Easy Access Room to be certain of such a shower. This cannot be done on the hotel website, the property needs to be contacted directly via email or phone. An Easy Access Room means this is a fully adapted disabled room. It is also means it is situated on the motorway side of the hotel. It is not possible to reserve such a room with a Darling Harbour View. I did not need a fully adapted room, only a walk-in shower, but there are no other choices here. I do not usually reserve adapted â€˜disabledâ€™ rooms as they are generally in the least favourable area of a hotel and I prefer a good view. Many hotels in Sydney do not have any walk-in showers at all. As this is an adapted â€˜disabledâ€™ room, the shower is a level roll in area with one glass wall and a curtain rather than a door. It has an integral shower seat and grab railings around the walls, with a floor to ceiling pole also. The floor is non-slip tiling. We found that at many popular times the water in the shower was only luke warm. The sink is a very small unit which can be used from a wheelchair, but there is very little stowage space on the small shelf. The hairdryer is attached to the wall here. The toilet is in the corner with a long grab rail attached to the wall on the right hand side. Any disabled guest who needs to transfer directly from a wheelchair would be able to do so from the left hand side only. There is a washing machine and a tumble drier in the bathroom. The directions for using the washing machine did not actually match the machine and we needed to ask for assistance. The bed was comfortable enough without feeling luxuriously so. There is a television in the bedroom as well as one in the living room. Although situated next to the motorway, our sleep was not disturbed at all by traffic noise, however we chose not to use the balcony, so as not to encourage traffic fumes into the room. It had no worthwhile view anyway. The CD player in the living room was broken on arrival and we needed to request a change, which was carried out the following morning. We also had problems with a persistent noise emitting from the dishwasher, although we had not even used it. This required visits from a technician on 2 separate occasions. I have to mention that although we had several different problems with equipment in the apartment, all issues were resolved courteously. The $30 daily charge for broadband is a downside of this hotel â€“ and I would say the same about all properties that make such a charge. There is no ethernet cable actually in the apartment, it needs to be requested from Reception if you do not have your own with you, with a $5 deposit. The hotel key swipe cards were too sensitive, which proved a little irritating in the lift. Nearby convenience stores were very expensive (due to the location) for those wishing to self cater. More positively, a take-away delivery service gave access to a large number of local take-aways which we used one night. Very convenient. The menus are displayed on the fridge door. Our daughter, who lives locally, parked her car in the garage over the evening of New Yearâ€™s Eve. The charge of $30 was reasonable for central Sydney, particularly as she did not retrieve it until the morning of 2nd January. This was much appreciated. The apartment was cleaned, with beds made, every day, when we had expected it might only be twice a week as it was an apartment rather than full service hotel. The dirty dishes were even washed. This was a very good service. We found that this property was perfectly serviceable as a city centre apartment hotel. Clean, comfortable and convenient for Darling Harbour. All staff were friendly and polite. This type of property is most useful for anyone staying in Sydney for longer than a few days, whether on business or for leisure. We appreciated being able to do our laundry. I am happy to recommend this property. For luxury full service hotels we went elsewhere (the Shangri-La, and the Sheraton on the Park are excellent choices of full service hotels having standard rooms with both bath and separate shower). For any potential disabled or reduced mobility travellers who have found this review useful, I advise them to also consult the website www.wheelie-easy-hotels.com which offers information on hotels world-wide. Hotel management representatives may also wish to enter information regarding their own property onto the same website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: holidayauckland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Medina Harbourside on Christmas day - our family that live in Sydney had organised lunch and as the apartment had a full kitchen they came to us. On checking in we were advised our room would not be available till 2.00pm we were shocked as we had been advised we would beable to check straight in. We then advised of all the food we had with us and the two behind the counter advised they could store it in the kitchen at the restuarant next door. We were very disappointed on prompting again I asked could they not check with house keeping I then got a flat no it wont be ready and you cant check in! It was Xmas day for goodness sake could there not be some compation and a bit of friendlyness. When the gentle man was on the phone the younger man on the desk could see our prediciment and picked up the phone then came back with you room is ready we were so appreciative we beleive that the first gentleman had the 2.00pm rule in his head and would not budge that was disappointing. The young man then organised a trolley and helped us unload the car of luggage and food and took it up for us. After that experience we were rapt we were in a back unit on 3rd floor, so no views but the double glazing did the trick no noise at all and also was cooler with the sun off the room for most of the day. The house keeping was ok and the room was done every day with light clean. We were there for 9 days and got a couple of full cleans in that time. The position of the Medina is fantastic and New Years Eve was a easy 1 minute walk to watch the fire works. We only had one other gripe the swipe cards were very sencetive an often did not work. We definately will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet getaway amongst the bustle”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastCas
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Medina Grand Harbourside December 2008. Room was a good size with all modern amenties which enabled own cooking etc. Stayed on the second floor (no balcony) but absolutely zero traffic noise and that was with a busy expressway directly alongside. Air conditioning allowed a controlled temperature. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Right next to busy Darling Harbour with great restaurants and shopping and easy walking distance to Circular Quay and CBD. Most enjoyable stay. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not strictly harbour side!”
Reviews.Author: GrandyM
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights here and it proved to be a great base for exploring Sydney. Our visit was a mixture of work and pleasure and the spacious one bedroom serviced apartment quickly became a great home base for us. The accommodation is fitted in a modern style to a level well above average. It has a bit of a corporate feel rather than a cosy feel - but that suited us. We had basement parking for a fee - but reasonable considering this is central Sydney. Access to food is easy, be it to prepare yourself or take away delivered by local restaurants. The hotel has no restaurant of its own - just a breakfast cafe, which is ok but nothing special. The best feature of this Medina is its closeness to Darling Harbour and all the attractions there. It is one block back from actually being 'harbour side', so the name is a little deceiving! You will not get a great harbour view, so this is not a place to people watch from. But as a great value, good quality hotel bang in the middle of Sydney, offering great value for money, it will take some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: hd21
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It's close to everything, Darling Harbour, Aquarium, Pubs, restaurants, China Town, CBD shopping, Fish Market (20 min's walk). Ferry is very closeby to take you to Circular Quay and other beaches. The room was very clean and almost had everything I need. I'm not fussy with the small room size, cause most of time I was not in the room anyway. I got a room in the quiet side with a balcony (room 54). No noise even though the property is located along a main road. This is not a 5 or 4 star hotel (maybe not even a hotel). It's more like a self-serviced apartment. It's very comfortable to stay here, and considering the price I paid, I'm very happy with the overall experience. I think I'll come back again. The only thing not very smooth is the way they charge your account. I booked the room on Medina's website, and I thought I paid for the accommodation already (cause I provided my CC details online). But it turned out that the money wouldn't be deducted until arriving. I had to re-check my CC statement online to ensure I hadn't paid for the accommodation before I provided my CC details again. There is a computer nearby with the access to the Internet. After I checked out and fully paid for my accommodation, the hotel still withheld certain amount of money and release the amount after 5-7 working days. It's quite confusing and takes me a while to understand. But overall everything is cool.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: reviewinsyd
Reviews.Content: We booked via the Medina webiste and got a great deal, it wasn't last minute either so it was great to get a good deal when we planned ahead. We had a One bedroom apartment and were extremely happy with the size of the room and the quality of the furnishings and apartment. Everything was in working order and the housekeepers must do a great job as the room was spotless. The staff were really friendly and helpful with all of our needs, going out of their way to book us into a restaurant nearby and hailing taxis for us when we needed them. The Hotel is in the best location at King Street Wharf at Darling Harbour - we could walk to restaurants, bars, the Mall and the Rocks. I would definitely stay here again, nothing was too much trouble and we had a relaxing and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Darling place on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Kalaheo_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed for three nights in a two bedroom apartment on the sixth floor of the Medina Harbourside Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms appointed very nicely and everything was extremely clean. We had a great view of Darling harbor with a 5 minute walk to the monorail station. We would definately stay there again when we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kagriff4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 08 and had a one bedroom apartment facing the harbour. Not particularly impressed with the decor but it was in a great location on Darling Harbour and was more than adequate. However we did return to the hotel for one night in June before flying home and was very disappointed with the room. It was facing the front and therefore we got all the noise and fumes from a motorway. In addition although the room was a non smoking it was situated on a smoking floor. So when our neighbour was in the hallway smoking, the smoke drifted into the apartment. Would stay again but would make sure we stipulated a harbour facing room and a non smoking floor!

Reviews.Title: “close to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed at this hotel in june 08 and booked through a travel agent. where the hotel is situated - it was SO hard to find. when we got to our rooms, our bags werent there and had to call for them to be brought up. the room was very big- and we just had the standard room. everything was very clean and the bathroom. and i was impressed with the sound proof doors that led to the very noisy street. restaurants and others attractions, such as the aquarium and wildlife place are right next to the hotel ( our balcony looked right into the wildlife place ) and i would suggest "casa di nico" - an awesome restaurant 30 seconds walk from the hotel. the bed, sloped when you slept on it- and our power all went out when we plugged in their iron. the front desk wasnt too helpful, as we asked for directions from the hotel to paddy's markets. the girl tryed to help but led us the wrong way, and we had to pull over and get directions ourselves. you would think they would know how to get places 10 mins away from the hotel. one good thing though, is you needed to use your room card in the elevator to access your floor - which is good security also. i would probably stay here again for the location - but would want to try another few places first!! but i will be coming back for the restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: leelou28
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Medina for 3 nights while working in Sydney and had a pretty nice stay. The room I was in was a very odd shape and was a bit small, probably due to it being one of their cheaper rooms. The furnishings were all nice as was the bathroom but I was disappointed that there was no bath and only a microwave. The area itself supposedly goes crazy on weekends but the hotel is a street away from the harbour and pretty quiet. I didn't really like having to walk across the walkway bridge and down the street lift to get to the hotel at night especially by myself as it didn't seem very safe. I had been looking forward to using the gym but it turned out to have antiquated equipment and some of it was broken. There was only 1 treadmill and 1 bike so I suppose they don't get too many long termers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, great rooms and location!”
Reviews.Author: DLPA
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place! So near The Rocks, it's just a walk away through the backdoor. A convenience store is nearby for everything you need and the apartment is a perfect size with a kitchenette in case you don't feel like going out to eat (but being so near the Rocks, who wouldn't?!). Service was good, they hailed taxis for us whenever we needed them. Just a walk across the bridge was the Four Points hotel where our conference was held so it was perfect for both work and play. Victoria street is a little bit of a walk away but it's not too taxing. Definitely a fantastic place, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Work or Play”
Reviews.Author: KlutzyGirl
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night but I was shocked by the HUGE room and the balcony. Was very clean, updated, bathroom immaculate. Staff were so friendly. Apologetic my room wasn't ready even though i had arrived several hours before check in. When a bellhop wasn't avaiable the front desk girl actually carried my bags up to the room herself! Never heard another guest. Proximity to CBD is good, a little more on the fringe of tourist attractions but buses/stations are less then 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience overall”
Reviews.Author: slroth
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The location is good - as others stated. The area really hops at night - with lots of the young business people out for dinner and drinks. The only downside was that the balcony was right over a street that had TONS of tour buses...so you could not really sit on the balcony without breathing in lots of fumes. I would suggest getting a room higher up. Service was very nice and we liked the cafe attached to the hotel. Very modern furniture that I kept hitting my knee, etc on (lots of sharp corners. I did think the room had a slightly damp feeling to it and the rug was a little dirty...although they are vacuumed every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BCFC79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location with Darling Harbour and the business district (if you are working) right on your doorstep. I had an executive studio on the top floor (6th) which had good views across the harbour and surrounding areas. What i would say is do not expect miracles with this hotel, it is basic and possibly in need of modernising. However, my room was kept clean to a relatively good standard and I had fresh towels etc every day. The best way of describing them is serviced apartments as opposed to a hotel. The Lime cafe which is the hotel's restaurant is poor at best - expect waits of up to an hour for a cooked breakfast - there are far better cafes/restaurants/food outlets within a short walk anyway. There are two supermarkets nearby but be warned they are not cheap - think they are cashing in on a captive market. Overall a pleasant enough stay but nothing you could get excited about; an excellent base for exploring the city though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SlaySlay
Reviews.Content: Situated at Darling Harbour, had a one bed aprt. Just walk outside and your at the harbour, which has 100's of really good resturants, with fantastic food. Hotel next to Wildlife centre and the Aquarium. Hotel was exceptionally clean, and the staff could not have been more helpful. Everything was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than a pokey little hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: jjumpstart
Reviews.Content: Our STUDIO PREMIER GRAND QUEEN apartment was spacious and contained everything a long distance traveller would require ... washing machine and drier, dishwasher, medium sized refrigerator, cooking facilities, dining table and 4 chairs, lounge, desk, broadband internet connection (extra charge), and 2 tv's. Not a great view, but the double glass sliding doors provided great soundproofing. A great location (only 100 metres from The Sydney Aquarium, and adjacent to the King St Wharf and it's ferries, water taxis, bars and restaurants). Much better that the 5 star hotel just up the road (and at a reasonable price). Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a busy buzzy location”
Reviews.Author: traveladventures
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is a wonderfully buzzy area, with masses of restaurants, attractions and shops, so it's a great place to stay. The Medina is right next to Wildlife World and the Aquarium and directly adjacent to many of the quays where the tour boats and water taxis depart from. Ideal. If you want harbour views, though, be sure to get a room on the top (6th) floor otherwise your view will be obscured by the building between the hotel and the harbour front. Our very nice suite had a smallish but perfectly comfortable bedroom (with a TV rather neck-achingly mounted on a stand in one corner at ceiling height!), sitting/dining room area with open plan kitchen and spacious bathroom with bath/shower, sink and, inside a cupboard, washing machine and tumble drier. Our daughter slept on a not-too-uncomfortable (though slightly institutional looking) put-you-up bed which we easily moved the furniture in the living area around to accommodate. The suite was well equipped, the furniture all comfortable and the standards of cleanliness impecable. We discovered two light fittings weren't working and both times someone promptly appeared with the correct bulb and profuse apologies. Breakfast in the restaurant is fine but not fabulous. The pool and gym are smallish but very well maintained. Would we stay there again? Like a shot!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Sydney027
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights and enjoyed the hotel. The only caution would be that not all the premier harbourview rooms actually have a good harbour view. Our first assigned room looked out at the back of the aquarium and there was only a glimmer of the harbour at the far end of the balcony. When we complained to staff.our room was switched and was much better. Note that this hotel is located behind the aquarium and other buildings so is not directly at the harbour. The kitchen facilities were good and there was a good grocery store about a five minute walk away. The pool was an outdoor one, but had a covered roof and 3 walls, so was still pleasant to swim in, even though the outside temperature was cool The pool was about 4 feet deep throughout so good for swimming lengths, but not OK for kids who would want to dive, etc. It was clean and I took full advantage of it often! The location was great, right near Darling Harbour. I had to attend a conference, and I could take a scenic walk from the hotel to the convention centre along the harbour's pedestrian walkway and this took about ten minutes or so. As well, the ferry to Sydney Harbour was almost outside the door of the hotel. Staff were friendly and professional. We would stay here again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Asado_NZ
Reviews.Content: Right next to Darling Harbour yet due to excellent sound insulation, almost no noise from the numerous bars and restaurants close by. We stayed in a very comfortable one bed apartment with full kitchen, not that we needed it much due to proximity of such great restaurants. Five minutes walking to the retail centre of Sydney, or Harbourside Mall, ten to Paddys Markets. Would happily stay again

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: frednuff
Reviews.Content: Apartment was small and dirty. Even had last guest's dirty underwear in the corner. AVOID!
